column2: NEW HAMPSHIRE DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
column6: NH

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column6: No U-turns

column2: 2. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column6: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column8: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.

column2: 3. Drivers must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians when:
column4: the driver is turning a corner and pedestrians are crossing with the light.
column6: pedestrians are crossing at an intersection without a traffic light and without a crosswalk.
column10: pedestrians are crossing the road in marked crosswalks.

column2: 4. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column6: stay in their lane.
column8: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column10: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 5. You are approaching a railroad crossing and the crossing signals are flashing. You should:
column4: do what the approaching vehicle does.
column6: slow down and look for a train.
column8: look for a train, then speed up.
column10: stop and look for a train.

column2: 6. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column6: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 7. To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked on a hill, if you are facing uphill you should:
column4: set the parking brake and keep the front wheels straight.
column6: turn the front wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column8: turn the back wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column10: turn the front wheels away from the curb or edge of the road.

column2: 8. This sign means:
column4: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column6: Double curve ahead.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column10: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.

column2: 9. When a traffic signal light turns green, you should:
column4: yield the right-of-way to larger vehicles.
column6: yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.

column2: 10. If you drive much slower than the posted speed limit you:
column4: always have the right of way.
column6: are a defensive driver.
column10: are driving safely and can avoid tailgaters.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column6: No turn on red
column10: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

column2: 12. To drive more safely at night:
column6: make sure your headlights are working properly.
column8: don’t drive when you are tired.

column2: 13. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column6: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.
column8: Allow the wheels to keep turning.

column2: 14. When you come to an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:
column4: stop at the intersection, then proceed when safe and observe the right-of-way rules.
column6: slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.
column8: stop only if cars are approaching the intersection.
column10: stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.

column2: 15. A broken white line:
column4: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column6: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column8: marks the right edge of the roadway.

column2: 16. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column6: travelling on HOV lanes.
column10: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Always come to a complete stop
column6: Lane reduction ahead
column8: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way
column10: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column6: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 19. Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
column6: early enough so other drivers know your intention.

column2: 20. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column6: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.

column2: 21. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column6: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column10: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column6: Yield

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column6: Highway entrance ramp ahead

column2: 24. Drivers who are 21 years of age or older considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
column6: .08 or more.

column2: 25. If your wheels drop off the pavement onto the shoulder of the road, you should:
column4: stop your car on the side of the road.
column6: maintain your current speed and turn onto the pavement.
column8: immediately come to a complete stop, then quickly turn back onto the pavement.
column10: slow down and carefully turn back onto the pavement.

column2: 26. Parking is not allowed:
column6: within 250 feet of a traffic light.
column8: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column10: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.

column2: 27. This sign indicates:
column6: a no passing zone.

column2: 28. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column6: change lanes.
column10: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.

column2: 29. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
column6: Anti-Collision Driving

column2: 30. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
column6: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.
column8: quickly change speed or lane position.

column2: 31. __________________ give you right-of-way to make a left turn.
column6: A flashing red light

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated
column6: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed
column8: Winding road ahead; slow down to the indicated speed
column10: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated

column2: 33. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column6: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column10: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.

column2: 34. If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:
column6: sound your horn.

column2: 35. You must yield to other drivers:
column4: when your traffic signal is a green.
column6: when the other drivers are on your left and you have reached an unmarked intersection at the same time.
column8: when it helps to prevent collisions.
column10: when they are driving a truck.

column2: 36. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column6: 10 minutes.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column6: No turns are allowed on this road

column2: 38. The yield sign means:
column6: Stop.
column8: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column10: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 39. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column6: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 40. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column6: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.
column8: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.
